msIdentifier.repository: Ministère des Affaires étrangères, Brussels, Belgium

revisionDesc.change: renamed file, inserted correct header template, transcribed page two, added translation

div1.p: La Sécretaire de le Legation d'Amerique est officieusement que la Morrison et Sheppard suit recue et me rete ultérieur de jugé sur ma vu il serait plus facile de reussi les temoins. Voici note ci-jointe

The Department of State at Washington has instructed the American Minister in Brussels by cable to request from the Belgian Government the postponement of the trial for libel instituted against the American missionaries Morrison and Sheppard. The date of the hearing of Morrison and Sheppard is at present set for May 25,1909, at Leopoldville. The Department of State also instructs the Minister in Brussels to request that the trial of Morrison and Sheppard be held at some point in the Congo so situated as to enable the defendents to secure witnesses and present testimony to Court without exposing them to the great inconvenience which would result from the haring of the case at Leopoldville.
A prompt response will be highly appreciated.

The Secretary of the American Delegation is officially that Morrison and Sheppard were rescued and ulterior judged under my where it would be more easily successful for them to give testimony. Here is the following note:
